column1: Title VII of Civil Rights Act (1964) Scope
column2: Prohibits discrimination based on **race, color, religion, national origin, or sex**.
Intentional discrimination against an individual based on a protected trait.
A policy that is facially neutral (unintentional) but falls more harshly on a protected group (e.g., strength test excluding women).
Prohibits discrimination against applicants and employees who are **40 years of age or older**.
Amends Title VII. Prohibits discrimination based on pregnancy, childbirth, or related medical conditions.
Prohibits wage disparity based on **sex** for equal work performed under similar conditions.
Prohibits employers from firing or discriminating against an employee **solely** because they have filed for bankruptcy.
Prohibits discrimination against qualified individuals who can perform essential functions with **reasonable accommodation**.
Employers are not required to provide accommodations that cause significant difficulty or expense.
Permitted if required for all employees in that category and results are kept in **separate, confidential files**.
Prohibits using genetic info (including family medical history) for hiring, firing, or promotion.
Prohibits health plans from using genetic info for **underwriting** or discriminating based on **predisposition** to disease.
Insurers are prohibited from requiring individuals to undergo genetic tests (except for voluntary research).
A private lawsuit can ONLY be filed after the EEOC process is exhausted and the agency issues a **Right to Sue letter**.
